intro: Stenostephanus breedlovei, commonly known as the Texas mountain laurel, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to cream-colored and appear in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The bark is smooth and grayish, and the plant is known for its hardiness in various soil types.
